meanings.definition: Continuing for an extended period of time without interruption.
meanings.sent1: The sustained rain lasted all day, making everything wet.
meanings.sent2: The marathon runner showed sustained energy throughout the race.
meanings.sent3: The sustained noise of the dripping faucet drove me crazy.
meanings.sent4: Her sustained effort in studying paid off with excellent grades.
meanings.sent5: The sustained applause from the audience showed their appreciation for the performance.

meanings.sent1: She sustained her friend by listening to her problems.
meanings.sent2: The bridge was designed to sustain heavy loads of traffic.
meanings.sent3: He sustained the weight of the world on his shoulders, figuratively speaking.
meanings.sent4: The pillars sustained the weight of the ancient temple.
meanings.sent5: The friendship sustained them through difficult times.

meanings.definition: To provide with the necessities for life.
meanings.sent1: The farmer sustained his family by growing crops.
meanings.sent2: Water is essential to sustain life on Earth.
meanings.sent3: The survival kit sustained them during their camping trip.
meanings.sent4: The charity aims to sustain underprivileged communities.
meanings.sent5: The mother's love sustained the child through sickness.
